maftir_additions.name: Shekalim
maftir_additions.summary: Every adult male must give a half-shekel annually as a contribution to the Temple service and atonement.

maftir_additions.name: Zachor
maftir_additions.summary: Command to remember what Amalek did to the Israelites during the exodus—attacking the weak—and to blot out their memory.

maftir_additions.name: Parah
maftir_additions.summary: The ritual of the red heifer (parah adumah) for purifying from corpse impurity, including slaughter, burning, and sprinkling ashes mixed with water.

maftir_additions.name: HaChodesh
maftir_additions.summary: God establishes the month of Nisan as the first month; instructions for the Passover lamb, unleavened bread, and the original Egyptian Passover night.

holiday_replacements.name: Trumpets (Rosh Hashanah)
holiday_replacements.summary: The birth of Isaac to Sarah in old age, Abraham's treaty with Abimelech at Beer-sheva, and the expulsion of Hagar and Ishmael; includes the special festival offerings for the Day of Trumpets.

holiday_replacements.name: Sukkot Day 1
holiday_replacements.summary: God's appointed festivals and holy convocations, including detailed laws and offerings for Sukkot (Tabernacles); emphasizes rejoicing with the four species and dwelling in booths.

holiday_replacements.name: Chol HaMoed Sukkot
holiday_replacements.summary: Moses pleads to see God's glory after the Golden Calf sin, receives the second set of tablets, and witnesses God's merciful attributes; paired with the daily increasing-then-decreasing bull offerings for Sukkot.

holiday_replacements.name: Shemini Atzeret (Last Great Day)
holiday_replacements.summary: Moses' final blessings on each tribe before his death, his ascent to Mount Nebo to view the land, and his unique prophecy; transitions to the creation account as the Torah cycle restarts.

holiday_replacements.name: Unleavened Bread Day 1
holiday_replacements.summary: Instructions for the Passover sacrifice, the night of watching when the firstborn are spared, and the exodus from Egypt; includes festival offerings.

holiday_replacements.name: Chol HaMoed Pesach
holiday_replacements.summary: Moses requests to see God's ways and glory after the Golden Calf, God proclaims His attributes of mercy, and the covenant is renewed with the second tablets; paired with Pesach intermediate offerings.

holiday_replacements.name: Unleavened Bread Day 7
holiday_replacements.summary: The Israelites' exodus from Egypt, Pharaoh's pursuit, the splitting of the Red Sea, the drowning of the Egyptian army, and Miriam's song of triumph (Shirat HaYam).

holiday_replacements.name: Shavuot
holiday_replacements.summary: The arrival at Sinai, preparation for revelation, thunder and lightning, God's descent on the mountain, and the giving of the Ten Commandments amid the people's awe.
holiday_replacements.note: For lunar calendars, Shavuot falls on day 16 of 3rd month (50 days from First Fruits on 1-16)

lunar_sabbath_notes.cycle_start: First Sabbath after Shemini Atzeret (7-22), which is day 29 of month 7
lunar_sabbath_notes.portions_per_year: 47-54 portions spread across approximately 46-50 regular Sabbaths
lunar_sabbath_notes.double_portions: Some portions may be combined when needed to complete the cycle by Shemini Atzeret
lunar_sabbath_notes.special_sabbaths_in_month_7: Day 15 (Sukkot) and Day 22 (Shemini Atzeret) have special readings

saturday_sabbath_notes.reference_date: A known Simchat Torah date to calculate week number
